#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Be Human
#Text=This article will walk you through the process of living as a human , from the basic necessities of life to the abstract reaches of human aspiration .
#Text=This article uses the Hierarchy of Needs ( conceived by Abraham Maslow , psychologist and noted human ) as its guiding foundation .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Meet basic physical needs .
#Text=Human beings cannot exist in a vacuum - without caring for certain physical needs , humans will soon die .
#Text=Take care of your basic well being or you 'll have a very hard time meaningfully pursuing the more advanced steps .
#Text=At bare minimum , humans need to :
#Text=Breathe oxygen .
#Text=Human beings ' most pressing need is to breathe air containing oxygen almost constantly .
#Text=At the absolute longest , humans can go only about 20 minutes without air ; most can only last a fraction of that time .
#Text=Eat edible foods and drink water .
#Text=Humans eat food for energy and to provide vital nutrients for essential body processes .
#Text=At a minimum , humans should consume adequate amounts of carbohydrates , proteins , and fats , as well as several essential vitamins and minerals .
#Text=Humans also drink water , as it is crucial for many internal processes .
#Text=The precise amounts of food and water you should consume as a human varies based on your size and your level of physical activity .
#Text=Sleep .
#Text=Humans still are n't completely sure what the purpose of sleep is , though we do know that it 's vital for physical and mental performance .
#Text=The healthiest adult humans usually sleep 7-8 hours a night .
#Text=Maintain homeostasis .
#Text=Essentially , humans need to keep their external environment from interfering with their internal body .
#Text=This can take many forms - for instance , wearing clothes to regulate body temperature and repairing wounds with sutures , wounds , etc.
#Text=Secure your safety .
#Text=A human 's second responsibility , after meeting his or her innate requirements for life , is to eke out his or her safety .
#Text=To thrive , humans ca n't be worried about whether they will starve or die - such thoughts will override any attempts to reach higher levels of human accomplishment .
#Text=Here are just a few ways to ensure you 're " safe " as a human :
#Text=Avoid danger .
#Text=Do n't stay near places or situations that can cause physical damage to your body .
#Text=Injuries can affect your physical health and even cause you to die .
#Text=Get or build a home .
#Text=Humans need a place to live that offers protection from the elements .
#Text=At the bare minimum , this place should have four walls and a place to sleep .
#Text=Pursue a living .
#Text=Most of the planet earth uses money .
#Text=Money can be exchanged for goods and services , including food , clothing , and shelter .
#Text=Most humans eventually get a job to receive a dependable stream of money .
#Text=Form human relationships .
#Text=Famous human
#Text=Aristotle is remembered as saying : " Man is by nature a social animal ; an individual who is unsocial naturally and not accidentally is either beneath our notice or more than human . "
#Text=In your life as a human , you will meet people .
#Text=Some will make you feel good - these are " friends . "
#Text=You may feel a sexual and/or romantic attraction to some :
#Text=Such a person is a " romantic interest " , who can develop into a spouse .

column1: #Text=A life lived alone is not a fulfilling one - spend time cultivating healthy relationships for a richer , more emotional life .
#Text=To maintain friendships , you 'll need to " hang out " with your friends .
#Text=Invite them over for brunch .
#Text=Talk about sports .
#Text=Forge a bond with your friends - help them when they need it , and they 'll be around to help you .
#Text=If you 're looking for a romantic relationship , most of them start when one person asks another out .
#Text=See our list of articles on asking humans out for guidance .
#Text=Cultivate your self-esteem .
#Text=Humans feel better when they consider themselves valuable and they know that others consider them valuable .
#Text=It 's easiest to respect yourself and for others to respect you if you 've achieved something .
#Text=Try to strive for success , whether it 's at your job or in other activities that you practice for fun ( these are called " hobbies . " )
#Text=Know and be confident in your own abilities .
#Text=Respect humans who respect you .
#Text=Relationships with others can help boost your self-esteem when you feel sad , but self-esteem begins within .
#Text=Do n't depend on other peoples ' approval for your self-esteem .
#Text=Validate your existence .
#Text=Once humans are physically secure , have a foundation of healthy relationships , and have a good self-image , they may begin to ponder questions such as " Why are we here ? "
#Text=Different humans ascribe a variety of purposes to human life .
#Text=Many humans adopt a set of moral principals or develop their own .
#Text=Others embark on creative endeavors , expressing their innermost thoughts through art .
#Text=Others still try to make sense of the universe through science or philosophy .
#Text=There 's no right way to make the most of your existence , but here are just a few ideas :
#Text=Subscribe to an existing ( or develop your own ) philosophy and/or religion .
#Text=Write , draw , play music , or dance .
#Text=Become an innovator in your craft .
#Text=Experience ( and care for ) nature .
#Text=Whatever you choose to do , try to make your mark on the world .
#Text=Improve the earth for those who come after you in some way , however small .
#Text=Learn how to love others and be loved .
#Text=Love is difficult to define ; the Merriam-Webster dictionary defines it as a feeling of intense affection , attachment , and/or desire for another human .
#Text=Many humans say that the best thing in life is to love ( and be loved by ) other human beings .
#Text=Many humans get married to commit to a life of loving a romantic partner .
#Text=Others still start families and have children so that they can love someone from the beginning of his or her life to the point that they die .
#Text=There 's no right way to live a love-filled life - all you can do is follow your heart and embrace love 's mysterious , inexplicable humanity .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Many human philosophies and religions advocate a concept called " The Golden Rule , " which is : " Do to others what you would have them do to you . "
